sources.title: THE PHANTOM BROADCAST
sources.description: Events surrounding the murder of a phony radio star and notorious ladies' man. Stars Ralph Forbes and Vivienne Osborne. Gail Patrick, Louise Beavers and George "Gabby" Hayes have supporting roles. Directed by Phil Rosen Released in 1933 Tape-transferred complete print a.k.a. "False Fronts"

sources.title: The Phantom Broadcast (1933) MYSTERY
sources.description:
Stars: Ralph Forbes, Vivienne Osborne, Arnold Gray
Director: Phil Rosen

A handsome radio singer has it all--fame, money, adoring fans--but what no one knows is that it is his accompanist, a hunchbacked piano player that is actually the voice behind the "singer"'s fame. When the singer turns up dead, suspicion falls upon his assistant and the girl the two men were in love with!

metadata.Plot: A handsome radio singer has it all--fame, money, adoring fans--but what no one knows is that his accompanist, a hunchbacked piano player, is actually the voice behind the arrogant, abusive "singer"'s fame. The two men fall for the same girl, and when the singer turns up dead, suspicion falls upon his assistant and the girl.
metadata.Actors: Ralph Forbes, Vivienne Osborne, Arnold Gray
